question: Jason has a plant stand at the local fair. He sells three kinds of plants: roses, daisies and lilies. He usually sells roses for $2.2328571428571427 per basket, daisies for $5.27923076923077 per basket and lilies for $5.186 per basket. Jason has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Jason sells 14 baskets of roses, 21 baskets of daisies and 40 baskets of lilies, how much will he make?
answer:
Jason will round his roses up from $2.2328571428571427 to $2, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Jason will round his daisies down from $5.27923076923077 to $5, since the number following the 5 is less than 5.
Jason will round his lilies down from $5.186 to $5, since the number following the 5 is less than 5.
Jason sells 14 roses*$2 = $<<14*2=28>>28
Jason sells 21 daisies*$5 = $<<21*5=105>>105
Jason sells 40 lilies*$5 = $<<40*5=200>>200
Altogether, Jason will make $28 + $105 + $200 = $<<28+105+200=333>>333
#### 333
